title: Test
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Exchange rate, with a total of 21 data points.
Overall Exchange rate has increased over the Year.

Exchange rate is slightly decreasing from 1999 to 2000, roughly constant from 2000 to 2001, rapidly increasing from 2001 to 2004, roughly constant from 2004 to 2006, slightly increasing from 2006 to 2007, roughly decreasing from 2007 to 2009, roughly increasing from 2009 to 2010, roughly decreasing from 2010 to 2012, roughly constant from 2012 to 2014, gradually decreasing from 2014 to 2015, roughly constant from 2015 to 2017, and lastly roughly decreasing from 2017 to 2019.
The steepest decrease occurs in between the Year 2014 and 2015.
Max Exchange rate about 1.47 was recorded at Year 2008
Min Exchange rate about 0.9 was recorded at Year 2001
This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Exchange rate, with a total of 21 data points. The chart has 5 significant trends.
The longest trend is moderately increasing which exists from 2005 to 2010.
Additionally, the next significant trend is extremely increasing which exists from 2001 to 2005.
Correspondingly, the next significant trend is moderately increasing which exists from 2016 to 2019.
Additionally, the next significant trend is slightly constant which exists from 2013 to 2016.
On the other hand, the next significant trend is moderately increasing which exists from 2010 to 2013.
